other.title: Dissertation Research with Camp Kan Du at Bradford Woods
other.description: Camp Kan Du is a summer camp for children with profound intellectual and multiple disabilities that gives them a typical camp experience. I developed and conducted a program evaluation of the camp session for staff, parents, and campers.

other.title: StRIVE Project
other.description: The STRIVE (Stress Reports in Variable Environments) project in the Jordan Lab at Indiana University focuses on the study of individuals’ experiences of stress. Here, I analyzed data related to individuals’ experiences of stress and disability status.

other.title: Therabot Project
other.description: The Therabot project, hosted in the R-House Lab at Indiana University, conducts research on robots and their use as socially assistive tools to improve individuals’ health. I managed recruitment, data collection, and communication with study participants throughout the duration of the study.

principles.title: Co-PIs
principles.details: Dr. Jenn Piatt and Dr. Selma Šabanović

other.title: Help at Home & Insights ViaQuest Community Solutions
other.description: Through Help at Home and Insights Consulting, I worked as a direct support professional for three adults with disabilities.

other.title: Bradford Woods
other.description: Bradford Woods is a medical specialty camp that provides services for youth with a variety of health conditions. I trained and supervised counselors in providing quality care for campers.

other.title: Indiana University - Bloomington
other.description: As an instructional assistant, I facilitated students’ development of semester capstone projects in a professional development seminar for students pursuing a Master of Public Health.
